Ability ideas:
Hadouken kind of ability
-exponentially speeds up after you launch it
-when it hits something, it has a blast radius based on how long it's travelled
-can be affected by other explosions or abilities (say, grapple or mines)
-leaves an energy circle behind for approx. 10 seconds that's slightly smaller than the blast itself and kills anyone that touches it

Homing missiles (not sure if you did this one already)
-also speeds up the longer it flies
-would make for some cool combos like grappling the missile to fly to your enemy
-you get the point

Spike ball (i wasn't sure what to call this one)
-basically puffs up your character and adds spikes everywhere around it
-makes you float for as long as you use the ability
-holdable
-chargeable (affects the size of the spike ball)
-if used too long, makes your character pop and die

Fusion ability
-if two players have this equipped, they can fuse into one single big blob
-the fusion wears off after some time
-the fused blob has all the abilities the two fused blobs harness
-has a special ability that basically works like a ground pound (jump, use in air, smashes you down onto the platform under you)

I think this game would definitely benefit from game modes

I can imagine a game mode where you have to collect an item that spawns around the map and respawns are infinite

Or a team mode where the two players are tied together by a small rope

Or a 1v3 mode where the 3 only get 1 ability each and have to combo off of eachother

One design tip is that many players don't know you can reflect beams off the water, so I would recommend more stages where players are incentivized to shoot towards the water so they can learn faster.

as you mention in the pin, there are exceptions. i think in StarCraft's case, upgrades that are just buttons are super important. it makes predicting WHAT your opponent is going to do not as cut-and-dry, it means you need to have more information and you need ways to get that information, like looking at the timing of other things or seeing when other things your opponent is doing is happening and what other things they are doing to piece together a fuller picture, but then this also puts some advantage on your opponent because they can try to do things to trick you into thinking they are doing something else.
